sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine — For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Leonardo Losoviz)
articles.description: Do you need search for your site, but haven’t found the time to add it? Within 15 minutes, Leonardo Losoviz explains how you can add a super powerful search that also looks super good. In this article, you’ll learn how to go from 0 to 100 with search.
articles.title: Adding Search To Your Site In 15 Minutes

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Eva Rio)
articles.description: In this article, Eva gives an overview of what embedded systems are and how they impact our lives. She presents three main learnings gained across her quest for creating better-embedded systems to enable the world as we know it.
articles.title: How To Apply UX Principles To Embedded Systems: Learnings From The Field

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: [DevFest for Ukraine](https://devfest.gdg.org.ua/) is a charitable online conference that will bring together 20 industry-leading tech speakers in support of Ukraine. June 14–15.
articles.title: DevFest For Ukraine, A Charity Conference On The Future Of Tech 🇺🇦

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Thomas Bohm)
articles.description: In this article, Thomas Bohm explains ways to test typefaces and other typographic issues. Though this article is slightly high-end and academic, fear not. The content will be interesting, especially for committed typeface designers and typographers. If you like complex issues and problems, this is for you.
articles.title: Measuring The Performance Of Typefaces For Users (Part 2)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Alexander Joseph)
articles.description: This article explores the evolution and the future of frontend tooling, presenting a new set of tools featuring a change in paradigm, platform, or both.
articles.title: The Future Of Frontend Build Tools

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Daniel Yuschick)
articles.description: CSS color-mix is an experimental function that blends two colors and can be used to simplify color palettes. You can define a color palette and theme without too much effort using CSS color-mix().
articles.title: Simplify Your Color Palette With CSS Color-Mix()

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Alexey & Alexander)
articles.description: Computer technologies have simplified the process of recording historical events, technological breakthroughs, contemporary art, and everyday life. However, the notion of digital archiving can be deceptive. Often our technical footprints are carved in sand rather than stone.
articles.title: Digital Museums For Digital History

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Sam Poder)
articles.description: In this article, Sam Poder explores how Prisma integrates with the Jamstack and why it’s a great solution for Serverless databases in JavaScript or TypeScript-based projects.
articles.title: The Case For Prisma In The Jamstack

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Thomas Bohm)
articles.description: This is the first part of this article, written especially for typeface designers and typographers. See how typefaces work, how to test them, and other broader typographic issues.
articles.title: Measuring The Performance Of Typefaces For Users (Part 1)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Zara Cooper)
articles.description: In this tutorial, you will learn how to create a group chat app. You will build a backend app using Node.js that will make group chats, authorize chat participants, and maintain sessions for them.
articles.title: How To Build A Group Chat App With Vanilla JS, Twilio And Node.js

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Ken Harker)
articles.description: In this article, Ken Harker explains what third-party resource requests really are and which common optimization strategies can help reduce the impact on the user experience. By carefully considering how third-party requests will fit into your website during the design stage, you’ll be able to avoid the most significant negative impacts.
articles.title: Don’t Sink Your Website With Third Parties

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: What could be a better way to welcome June than with some colorful inspiration? Well, we might have something for you: wallpapers created with love by artists and designers from across the globe.
articles.title: Expand Your Horizons (June 2022 Desktop Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Drew McLellan)
articles.description: In this episode of the Smashing Podcast, we ask why accessibility really matters and why it is so important to get it right. Smashing’s Vitaly Friedman talks in-depth to Sara Soueidan to find out.
articles.title: Smashing Podcast Episode 47 With Sara Soueidan: Why Does Accessibility Matter?

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Patrick Brosset)
articles.description: How many browser DevTools panels do you commonly use in your day-to-day web development? One? Three? Probably not that many more. In this article, Patrick Brosset shines the spotlight on a number of tools that people don’t use or even know about. Let’s dive in!
articles.title: What’s That (Dev) Tool?

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vijay Verma)
articles.description: In this article, Vijay describes his learning experiences during the design stages of creating his 3dicons image library (a free library for product screens, social media posts and marketing campaigns), which you can download and use for free.
articles.title: Open-Source 3dicons Library: Case Study And Free Downloads

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Daniel Yuschick)
articles.description: From working with design handoffs to supporting custom themes in a design system, the CSS `color-contrast()` function can become a cornerstone for developers by enforcing accessible UIs.
articles.title: Manage Accessible Design System Themes With CSS Color-Contrast()

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Frank Joseph)
articles.description: In this article, Frank Joseph explains both weak and strong references in JavaScript, as well as the concept of reachability. Let’s dig in!
articles.title: Understanding Weak Reference In JavaScript

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Kata Nagygyörgy & Diana Lakatos)
articles.description: This article is a case study of how the platformOS team has researched, developed, and iteratively adjusted their onboarding processes over more than three years to eventually create the multiple award winning developer experience they provide today.
articles.title: Developing An Award-Winning Onboarding Process (Case Study)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Adrian Bece)
articles.description: CSS is constantly evolving, and some cool and useful properties either go completely unnoticed or are not talked about as much as others for some reason or another. In this article, we’ll cover a fraction of those CSS properties and selectors.
articles.title: Lesser-Known And Underused CSS Features In 2022

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Greg Dickens)
articles.description: In this article, we will see step-by-step how you can get the best of customization with easy admin by using Ghost as a headless CMS for a Gatsby static site — everything for free.
articles.title: The Ultimate Free Solo Blog Setup With Ghost And Gatsby

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Benjamin Ajibade)
articles.description: In this article, Benjamin Ajibade introduces Kubernetes to front-end engineers and explaines why Kubernetes is integral in a production-ready microservice architecture. Some key terms that are important for team collaboration will be discussed and conclude the post with a quick deployment to getting started as a beginner.
articles.title: Kubernetes For Frontend Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Drew McLellan)
articles.description: In this episode, we ask how one man can go from designing websites for local bands to heading up Google Fonts Knowledge. Smashing’s Vitaly Friedman talks to Elliot Jay Stocks to find out.
articles.title: Smashing Podcast Episode 46 With Vitaly Friedman: Who Is Elliot Jay Stocks?

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Nick Babich)
articles.description: Let’s take a closer look at how you can create your very own WordPress site up and running created and hosted with the Elementor Cloud Website.
articles.title: The Modern Way To Create And Host A WordPress Site

articles.author: Ihechikara Vincent Abba
articles.description: In Java, you use arrays to store a collection of variables (with the same data type) in a single variable.  In many cases, the values stored in an array appear in a random order. Using the  Arrays class in Java, you have access to various methods you can
articles.title: Java Sort Array – How to Reverse an Array in Ascending or Descending Order with Arrays.sort()

articles.author: Sumeet Ninawe
articles.description: Web applications are built to provide various online services to end-users. Developing and hosting these services involves hard work and talent. And it all begins with an idea.
